page.title: 17UPHILL
page.content: TO THE SOUTH OF WESTON-SUPER-MARE,TO WHICH IT IS SLOWLY BECOMING ATTACHED IS UPHILL.IT WAS BUILT IN THE SHADOW OF THE WESTERN PART OF THE MENDIP HILLS AND ON A PILL,OR STREAM,WHICH FEEDS INTO THE RIVER AXE. UPHILL HAS A LONG HISTORY.IN ROMAN TIMES,LEAD,FROM THE MINES AT CHARTER HOUSE ON MENDIP-WAS SHIPPED TO GAUL AND THENCE TO ROME.HUBBS THE VIKING HELD THE AREA AND USED IT AS A BASE. TODAY UPHILL IS DOMINATED BY IT'S HILL AND ON IT BY IT'SA ROOFLESS CURCH, WHERE OCCASIONAL SERVICES ARE HELD BY IT'S NEIGHBOURING WINDMILL,NOW SAIL-LESS. PART OF THE TOWN IS VICTORIAN,BUT IN RECENT YEARS NEW HOUSING HAS BEEN BUILT TO MORE THAN DOUBLE IT'S POPULATION. A PLEASANT COASTAL TOWN WITHIN THE HUSTLE AND BUSTLE OF IT'S NEIGHBOUR.
